description: Unit: workflow model ADR decisions are reflected in code-level invariants (schema forbids node steps)
Unit: workflowDefinition schema accepts only control blocks + action steps (rejects non-control non-action shapes)
Unit: publishValidation rejects workflows with duplicate step IDs
Unit: baseline behavior snapshot harness can publish/start/resume a canonical workflow
Unit: Effect schema serializes and deserializes deterministically
Unit: Effect persistence mapping produces correct workflow_run_waits rows for event wait
Unit: Effect persistence mapping produces correct workflow_run_waits rows for human task
Unit: effect application transitions run to WAITING and preserves node_path/pc pointer appropriately
Unit: action-emitted effect is logged with stable redacted preview (no secrets)
Unit: effect resolved log entry is emitted and links wait_id to run_id/step
Integration: event wait action pauses run and resumes on submitWorkflowEventAction
Integration: human task action pauses run and resumes when task completion event is submitted
Integration: retry scheduling works when implemented via effects (WAITING retry with timeout)
Integration: effect metadata is visible in run studio (wait type, key, event name, timeouts)
Unit: assign action writes into vars/payload/meta with the same semantics as current transform.assign
Unit: set-state action updates envelope meta.state
Unit: email parse/render actions produce expected outputs and preserve redactions
Unit: ActionStep schema accepts valid actionId/version/inputMapping and rejects missing fields
Unit: ActionStep validation rejects unknown actionId@version
Unit: ActionStep validation enforces required fields via action input schema
Unit: action idempotencyKey expression is resolved and passed through consistently
Unit: migrator rewrites known built-in node steps to ActionSteps (golden fixture)
Unit: migrator leaves control blocks untouched and preserves step ordering
Unit: publish gate auto-migrates drafts and blocks publish on unknown legacy shapes with actionable error
Integration: admin validate-draft endpoint returns (a) migration preview (b) publishValidation results
E2E: designer creates a new workflow using only ActionSteps + control blocks and publishes successfully
E2E: designer edits an existing workflow and does not reintroduce deprecated node-step shapes
E2E: palette displays wait/human-task as action-backed steps with correct configuration UI
E2E: trigger payload mapping is migrated into explicit mapping ActionSteps and is visible in designer
E2E: callWorkflow block is migrated to workflowKey and is visible in designer
E2E: publish UI shows derived event schema ref as the workflow input contract
DB migration: workflow key is required and uniqueness constraint prevents duplicates
Integration: workflow key edit endpoint validates format and enforces reserved namespaces
Unit: callWorkflow schema uses workflowKey and rejects workflowId shape
Integration: runtime resolves workflowKey to workflowId and starts child run
Unit: callWorkflow migrator rewrites workflowId to workflowKey when resolvable and reports when not
Integration: bundle import preserves callWorkflow references by workflowKey across envs
Unit: contract derivation picks effective source schema ref (catalog/override) deterministically
Integration: event submission matches and resumes waits based on deterministic contract
E2E: event catalog shows payload schema ref and indicates workflow dependencies
Unit: workflow lint rule flags drafts lacking explicit mapping steps where required
Unit: bundle import validates workflows via publishValidation and returns structured errors/warnings
Unit: bundle dry-run mode performs no DB writes and returns a summary
Integration: bundle import/export round-trip across envs with key identity and explicit contract
Unit: bundle header validation remains strict (format + version) after schema simplification
Unit: compiler produces a linear IR and source map for a simple if/else workflow
Unit: compiler produces correct jump targets for try/catch and forEach
Integration: publish stores compiled IR and runtime executes IR producing identical outcomes to interpreter
Integration: logs/step history remain stable and readable when executing compiled IR
Integration: bulk migration tool migrates keys + callWorkflow + trigger mapping + node->action in one pass
Integration: migration tool is idempotent (second run is a no-op) and reports summary
Integration: telemetry emits counters for successful migrations and blocked publishes
Integration: rollout flag disables simplified-path publishes/execution when turned off
Regression: runtime no longer requires node-type registry for execution in the simplified model
Regression: payload schema mode/provenance removal does not break publish or event submission flows
Regression: Ajv bundle schema plumbing removal does not reduce bundle safety (publishValidation catches errors)
Docs: updated documentation matches actual behavior and code pointers are correct
Unit: action catalog metadata is complete and stable for designer consumption
Unit: action version policy resolves deterministically given a registry snapshot
Integration: publish freezes resolved action versions into the published definition
Regression: runtime executes the frozen action versions even if registry default changes later
Unit: publishValidation validates effect configs (timeouts, required fields, wait types)
Integration: canceling a run cleans up outstanding waits/tasks according to policy
Integration: event wait timeout resumes run with resumeError and produces expected logs
Unit: action runtime API surface (ctx.*) enforces invariants and returns consistent errors
Unit: mapping action resolves expressions/secrets and produces redaction paths
Unit: schema.assert action validates payload/vars against schemaRef and emits warnings/errors
Unit: publishValidation emits actionable codes for action version pinning problems
Integration: effect application failure produces a dead-letter entry with recoverability hint
Integration: admin retry endpoint can replay a failed effect safely (idempotent semantics)
Unit: workflow key linter enforces reserved prefixes and allowed characters
Integration: workflow key rename constraints enforced (blocked when referenced/published unless forced)
Integration: key backfill job generates stable keys and avoids collisions
Unit: callWorkflow version selector resolves deterministically to an existing published version
Integration: workflow reference index finds inbound callWorkflow references by workflowKey
Integration: deletion is blocked when referenced unless forced and reports references
Integration: schema-ref conflict on event submission is surfaced (UI/API) and tracked via telemetry
Unit: publishValidation requires event catalog entry or explicit override for event triggers
Integration: reconcile tool updates affected workflows when catalog schema refs change
Integration: bundle import conflict resolution (key collisions) behaves correctly with force and without
Integration: bundle partial import imports selected workflows and reports warnings for missing references
Integration: bundle export transitive closure includes referenced workflows by workflowKey
Unit: bundle manifest includes hashes and audit fields; hash changes on any workflow change
Unit: stable JSON normalization makes bundle output diff-stable across runs
Integration: IR compiler flag enabled -> publish stores IR; runtime still defaults to interpreter if configured
Unit: IR source map allows mapping PC back to original step path for logs/UI
Integration: IR conformance check asserts interpreter vs IR execution equivalence for canary workflows
Integration: migration dashboard surfaces counts of drafts needing migration and top blocker codes
Integration: tenant migration runner batch-migrates drafts safely and reports progress
Integration: migration runner rate limits and supports dry-run and rollback strategy
Regression: event submission, run studio, and task inbox still function after schema simplification
Regression: compatibility shim allows older clients to read definitions during migration window
Unit: publish-time validations catch missing schema refs and unsatisfiable inputs early with actionable errors
Unit: error translator converts runtime error shapes to publish-time guidance text consistently
Docs: action authoring guide covers effects, secrets, redactions, and idempotency and matches code
Docs: workflow contract guide matches contract derivation and migration behavior
Docs: bundle guide matches dry-run, conflict resolution, and auditing behavior
Guard: CI fails if node-type runtime execution paths are reintroduced
Guard: CI fails if payloadSchemaMode-based publish behavior is reintroduced
Guard: CI fails if Ajv bundle schema validation plumbing is reintroduced
Integration: cleanup checklist completion does not break existing canary workflows
Unit: fixtures/templates produce valid simplified-model workflows and validate/publish successfully
CI: canary workflow suite publishes, triggers, waits, resumes, and exports/imports successfully
Unit: effect serialization rejects unknown wait types and preserves forward-compatible fields
Unit: effect persistence stores correlation keys and event names exactly as resolved (string normalization)
Unit: effect persistence enforces payload size limits and truncates log previews safely
Integration: multiple outstanding waits for same key/event resolve FIFO and only once
Integration: submitting an event with mismatched tenant does not resolve waits (tenant isolation)
Unit: action.call inputMapping secret refs are validated and missing secrets are reported at publish
Unit: action.call onError=continue records error in envelope and continues to next step
Integration: action.call retry policy schedules retries and respects maxAttempts
Integration: action.call defaultRetry is applied consistently for actions with retry hints
Unit: publishValidation rejects workflows with invalid expressions in mappings and conditions
Unit: publishValidation rejects non-JSON-serializable workflow definitions and reports root error
Unit: publishValidation collects secretRefs from both mappings and config and reports them
E2E: publishing a migrated draft shows a migration summary and does not silently change semantics
E2E: designer prevents saving invalid workflow key formats and shows inline validation
E2E: designer action version pin UI produces expected persisted version pins
E2E: action configuration UI is schema-driven and blocks invalid inputMapping keys
Integration: workflow key uniqueness conflicts return 409 with structured details
Integration: exporting workflows includes key and fails if key missing (no silent export)
Integration: callWorkflow by key works with explicit version and with latest-published selector
Integration: workflow reference index stays consistent after imports, deletions, and key renames
Integration: contract derivation handles missing catalog schema refs by blocking publish with error
Integration: event catalog schema ref changes trigger reconcile warnings for dependent workflows
Regression: removal of trigger payloadMapping does not break event-triggered workflow starts when mapping steps exist
Integration: bundle dry-run returns accurate diff summary (create/update/delete) without DB writes
Integration: bundle partial import rejects selection that omits required referenced workflows unless forced
Integration: bundle export transitive closure is stable and deterministic
Integration: bundle manifest hashes detect tampering and are verified on import (when enabled)
Integration: publish stores IR in workflow_definition_versions with compiler version metadata
Integration: runtime executes IR for canary workflow and produces identical waits/logs
Unit: IR source maps support jumping from run logs to designer step selection
Regression: interpreter fallback still works when IR data is absent or invalid
Integration: tenant migration runner reports per-workflow outcomes and top error codes
Integration: migration runner supports dry-run mode and produces a stable report
Integration: migration runner does not exceed rate limits and yields predictable progress
Security: manage/publish/admin permissions are enforced consistently for new endpoints (validate draft, bundle dry-run, reconcile tool)
Security: logs/snapshots redact secret-derived fields in mapping and effect payloads
Observability: effect created/resolved events include correlation keys and step pointers consistently
Observability: telemetry emitted for migration outcomes and publish failures includes tenant and workflow key safely
Unit: rollout flag gates (a) publish auto-migration (b) runtime execution path selection
Regression: rollout flag off keeps existing behavior and does not break running workflows
Unit: code health gate for node-type runtime usage triggers on forbidden imports/exports
Unit: code health gate for payloadSchemaMode triggers on forbidden field access patterns
Unit: code health gate for Ajv bundle schema triggers on forbidden imports of bundle schema validator
Integration: fixture workflows under simplified schema can be imported/published and executed
Integration: cleanup phase removes deprecated paths without breaking canary suite
Regression: workflow reference index and bundle transitive export remain correct after cleanup removals
Regression: event catalog UX still loads and shows schema refs after contract unification cleanup
Integration: admin effect retry endpoint is disabled by default and can be enabled with config
Integration: schema.assert action produces warnings only (non-blocking) when configured for lint-style behavior
Integration: bundle import validates schema refs exist in registry and reports missing refs clearly
Integration: bundle import refuses to import workflows with unknown actions unless forced (policy)
Unit: stable JSON normalization preserves numeric/string distinctions and ordering rules
Integration: child workflow output mapping works when callWorkflow is key-addressed and definitions are migrated
Integration: child workflow failures propagate as ActionError and are caught by try/catch correctly
Integration: forEach concurrency still respects concurrency limits with action-backed steps
Integration: continue-on-error semantics for forEach items remain correct after action-step unification
E2E: end-to-end flow (event trigger -> mapping -> action.call -> human task -> resume -> child workflow call) succeeds under simplified model
